definition[0]: to make things into a neat pile
definition[1]: used to talk about how good something is compared with something else
example[0]: Parents want to know how their kidsâ€™ schools stack up against others.
definition[2]: if a number of things stack up, they gradually collect or get stuck in one place
example[1]: Traffic stacked up behind the bus.
definition[3]: to have a particular performance when compared with something
example[2]: How does their product stack up against our own?
